page.title: 05CHILWELL. Background.
page.content: {Chilwell}is located on the W.S.W. side of Nottingham, which is about 7Km. away and the River Trent which lies 2Km to the south. Chilwell is now a residential area with few places of work, although there are a few{textile works}and a large Government Depot. This was once a very important employer during the first and second world wars but is now to be taken over. Chilwell was a farming settlement until the mid 19th century when several{lace}mills were built. Lace is still made on frames in one factory in Chilwell. Chilwell is now best known in the area for its Sports centre and large Comprehensive School.
